result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamar D Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lamar D Bryant is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lamar D Bryant was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW hearing February 12, 2016 at 1:15 p.m. in Br. 38.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and surcharge.  
Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.   Any cash bail on deposit be be applied.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdmeanor crime of domestic violence.

No contact with the victim unless requested by victim and then only after prior approval of agent or the Court.
No contact with firearms.
No new law violations.
Attend and successfully complete anger management and continued programming.  Attend and successfully complete  treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
02-12-16/ Judge Michelle Havas
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 15 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC. 

STAYED pending review hrg.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamar D Bryant

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: REQUEST TO ISSUE CIVIL JUDGMENT FOR RESTITUTION RECEIVED AND FORWARDED TO ALI. OS
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  7-15-2016 review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Lamar D Bryant in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is somewhat compliant with probation.  Agent requesting condition time.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance.  Court stays condition time.    Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Amended JOC reflects 02-12-16 Court order imposing   15  days of condition time

Defendant Lamar D Bryant in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 15 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lamar D Bryant in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.
The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction,  with credit for 4 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 25 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Lamar D Bryant in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have resolved case.  As count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Count 2 is ordered dismissed.
Victim is not present today so sentencing must be adjourned to another date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lamar D Bryant in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 10-5-2015 at 8:15 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court date, signed and filed.   mld

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lamar D Bryant in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Defendant Lamar D Bryant in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
